intro: Magnistipula bimarsupiata, commonly known as the two-lobed magnistipula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed stipules, which are modified leaf structures at the base of the petioles. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a structure typical of the Malvaceae family. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
